skill.name: architectural-analysis
skill.description: Deep architectural audit focused on finding dead code, duplicated functionality, architectural anti-patterns, type confusion, and code smells. Use when user asks for architectural analysis, find dead code, identify duplication, or assess codebase health.
skill.summary: Deep architectural audit focused on finding dead code, duplicated functionality, architectural anti-...
skill.author: Cygnusfear

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Contains only instructions for Claude on how to perform architectural analysis using existing Claude capabilities. No file system, network, or command execution capabilities beyond what Claude already provides.

content.value_statement: Codebases accumulate dead code, duplication, and architectural issues over time. This skill provides a systematic framework for comprehensive code analysis, identifying cleanup opportunities and quantifying technical debt.
actual_capabilities: Detect dead code and unused exports across entire codebase
Identify duplicated functionality and logic across files
Find architectural anti-patterns like god objects and circular dependencies
Analyze type issues including any usage and type assertions
Detect code smells such as long methods and magic numbers
limitations: Does not modify or delete any code - analysis only
Cannot access codebases outside of explicitly shared context
Analysis accuracy depends on Claude's file reading capabilities
Does not integrate with external static analysis tools

use_cases.title: Codebase Health Assessment
use_cases.description: Evaluate legacy codebases for refactoring priorities and technical debt quantification

use_cases.title: Architecture Review
use_cases.description: Identify architectural anti-patterns and coupling issues across team codebases

use_cases.title: Code Quality Metrics
use_cases.description: Generate reports on code duplication and cleanup potential for sprint planning

prompt_templates.title: Quick Scan
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase for dead code. Map the structure, identify unused exports, and list files that can be deleted.

prompt_templates.title: Duplication Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for duplicated functionality across the codebase. Group similar implementations and estimate total duplicated lines.

prompt_templates.title: Full Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive architectural analysis: dead code, duplication, anti-patterns, type issues, and code smells. Generate a full report.

prompt_templates.title: Type Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze type issues in this codebase. Find all any usage, type assertions, and @ts-ignore comments. Prioritize by severity.

output_examples.input: Analyze my project for dead code and duplication
output: Dead Code Found: 5 files completely unused, 12 unused exports
Duplication Groups: 4 identified (most duplicated: email validation with 3 copies)
Cleanup Potential: ~2,400 lines could be removed or consolidated

best_practices: Run architectural analysis before major refactoring sprints to prioritize efforts
Use generated reports to justify technical debt cleanup to stakeholders
Re-run analysis periodically to track code health improvements over time
anti_patterns: Running analysis without reviewing all findings in detail
Deleting flagged code without verifying it is truly dead
Ignoring architectural anti-patterns identified in the report

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill only analyzes code and generates reports. It never edits, deletes, or modifies any files.

faq.question: What file types does it support?
faq.answer: Designed for TypeScript and JavaScript projects. Can analyze any text-based code with appropriate context.

faq.question: How long does analysis take?
faq.answer: Time scales with codebase size. Small projects take seconds, large monorepos may require multiple Claude sessions.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens within your Claude session. No code is sent to external services beyond standard Claude processing.

faq.question: Can it integrate with ESLint or other tools?
faq.answer: No. This skill uses Claude's native capabilities for analysis. External tool integration would require additional setup.

faq.question: How is this different from type checking?
faq.answer: Type checking validates correctness. Architectural analysis identifies structural issues like duplication, dead code, and design problems that compilers do not detect.
